result.execSummary:
The defendant Valente J Silas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections, during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.

*Restitution is set at zero.*

Obtain GED/HSED.
Obtain and maintain employment or job training program.

No violent contact if in BIP and agent approves.
3rd party contact for the purpose of time with children as approved by agent.
No new law violations.
No drugs.
No alcohol.
Expungement if all conditions are fulfilled.

Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling and continue programming.
Attend and complete parenting classes.

Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.
Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Received in writing and filed:  Probation Status EMAIL from Zakiyyah Berry
probation/parole agent. ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE. Offender's Interstate Compact transfer request was approved for Chicago, IL.

Defendant Valente Silas in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Valente Silas in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
AS TO CHARGE: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint. Judgment of conviction entered.  The Court finds that the State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Dominique J. (via telephonics).
Defendant sentenced to serve 5 MONTHS (CONSECUTIVE to case 2013CM1338), in the House of Correction with credit for 0 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 MONTHS.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
* Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 DAYS
   in the House of Correction.  Stayed pending review.
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
   counseling and continue programming.
* Attend and complete parenting classes.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
   treatment deemed appropriate.
* No violent contact if in BIP and agent approves.    
* 3rd party contact for the purpose of time with 
   children as approved by agent.  
* Obtain GED/HSED.
* Obtain and maintain employment 
   or job training program.
* No firearms; weapons.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence
   surcharge, DNA surcharge and supervision fees as 
   determined by the Department of Corrections, 
   during period of probation or CIVIL JUDGMENT.
* Restitution is set at zero.
* No new law violations. 
**COURT ORDERED PROBATION REVIEW HEARING IN BR. 38 ON 9-11-2015 AT 1:30 PM. 
48USC Section 922(g)(9) prohibits possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence.
 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.   
Expungement if all conditions are fulfilled.  
Court may consider shortening probation, if completed after (1) one year.
Parties are advised that EFFECTIVE August 3, 2015, this case will be assigned to JUDGE WAGNER, BRANCH 38, in Room 504 in the Courthouse.  mld

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Valente Silas not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Final Pretrial Conference held off the record.  Case adjourned for Plea Hearing in Branch 4 on 6-25-2015 at 8:30 am.   mld
Victim, Doninique J., appeared to modify the no contact order.  Court denied request and maintains the current no contact order.   mld

Defendant Valente Silas in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Valente Silas in custody.  Nicolas J. Heitman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State will copy and forward the discovery for new defense counsel.  Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference in Branch 4 on 6-9-2015 at 8:30 am.  All parties are advised that effective 8-3-2015, this case will be assigned to the Honorable Jeffrey Wagner, Branch 38 in Room 504 of the Courthouse.   mld
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Dominique J

Defendant Valente J Silas in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Valente J Silas in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised due to lower pending case this case is assigned to Judge Flanagan, Branch 04.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
